docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 8 President Johnson, scornful in private but silent in public, is brushing aside his critics in the Senate and will leave for Uruguay on Monday to give the same pledges of more aid to Latin Amercia that he had hoped Congress would...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 8 President Johnson, scornful in private but silent in public, is brushing aside his critics in the Senate and will leave for Uruguay on Monday to give the same pledges of more aid to Latin Amercia that he had hoped Congress would endorse in advance.
docs.abstract: Johnson reptd bitter about Sen com action; rejects some Sens offer to push resolution through; expects Cong to approve aid to common mkt after conf; defeat not expected to damage his prestige at conf; resolution dispute revd; Fulbright opposed draft from start as too broad but Johnson believed other com members were favorable

docs.snippet: It will not be a triumphant tour of the hemisphere, only a quick trip to a little spit of land near Montevideo, Uruguay, for a wellguarded conference with the other American heads of government. Many a Latin American will still recall the big...
docs.lead_paragraph: It will not be a triumphant tour of the hemisphere, only a quick trip to a little spit of land near Montevideo, Uruguay, for a wellguarded conference with the other American heads of government. Many a Latin American will still recall the big visitor's controversial military intervention in the Dominican Republic two years ago.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 9 (AP) --The Senate Democratic leader, Mike Mansfield of Montana, said tonight that "some unnamed source somewhere in the executive department" blocked Senate action on a resolution for President Johnson to take to a meeting of...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 9 (AP) --The Senate Democratic leader, Mike Mansfield of Montana, said tonight that "some unnamed source somewhere in the executive department" blocked Senate action on a resolution for President Johnson to take to a meeting of hemispheric chiefs of state.
docs.abstract: Sen Mansfield scores 'unnamed source' in exec for describing resolution as 'worse than useless'; holds even Sen version could aid Johnson at conf

docs.snippet: An epidemic of guerrilla fighting is sweeping over Latin America. When their numbers are added, their arms and finances estimated, and their present ineffectiveness considered, the temptation is to brush the guerrillas aside as mere irritations.
